intro: Jaegeria hirta, commonly known as the hairy jaegeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Jaegeria hirta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
